aliases: glucose fasting, fasting glucose, fbs, fbg, glucose (fasting), plasma glucose fasting, blood sugar fasting
interpretation_summary: 100–125 suggests prediabetes. ≥126 indicates diabetes if persistent.

aliases: pp glucose, postprandial glucose, glucose pp 2 hours, glucose (pp 2 hours), glucose post prandial
short_description: Measures blood sugar 2 hours after meal
interpretation_summary: 140–199 indicates impaired glucose tolerance. ≥200 suggests diabetes.

aliases: hba1c, hb a1c, glycated hemoglobin, glycosylated hemoglobin, haemoglobin a1c, hb a1c hplc
interpretation_summary: 5.7–6.4% prediabetes. ≥6.5% diabetes.

aliases: total cholesterol, cholesterol total, cholesterol serum, chol total
interpretation_summary: High levels increase cardiovascular risk.

aliases: hdl cholesterol, hdl-c, hdl cholesterol direct
interpretation_summary: Low HDL increases heart disease risk.

aliases: ldl cholesterol, ldl-c, ldl cholesterol direct
interpretation_summary: High LDL significantly increases heart disease risk.
High levels linked to metabolic syndrome.
High levels associated with triglyceride elevation.

aliases: creatinine serum, serum creatinine, creatinine blood
interpretation_summary: Elevated levels suggest reduced kidney function.

aliases: urea serum, blood urea, bun urea nitrogen
interpretation_summary: High values may indicate kidney dysfunction or dehydration.

aliases: uric acid serum, uric acid blood
interpretation_summary: High levels linked to gout and kidney stones.
High levels indicate liver or muscle injury.
Elevated levels suggest liver inflammation.
High values may indicate bile duct obstruction or bone disorder.
High levels often linked to alcohol use or fatty liver.

short_description: Breakdown product of red blood cells
interpretation_summary: Elevated levels cause jaundice and suggest liver dysfunction.
Low levels suggest malnutrition or liver disease.

short_description: Major blood protein made by liver
interpretation_summary: Low levels indicate liver or kidney disease.
Abnormal levels may indicate infection or immune disorder.

aliases: tsh, tsh 3rd generation, hs tsh, thyroid stimulating hormone
interpretation_summary: High TSH suggests hypothyroidism. Low suggests hyperthyroidism.
Helps assess thyroid function along with TSH.
Interpreted with TSH for thyroid diagnosis.
<20 indicates deficiency affecting bone and immunity.

aliases: vitamin b12, vit b12, cyanocobalamin serum
short_description: Essential vitamin for nerves and blood cells
interpretation_summary: Low levels cause anemia and nerve damage.
Low levels indicate anemia.

aliases: total wbc count, wbc count, tlc
interpretation_summary: High suggests infection. Low suggests immune suppression.
Low increases bleeding risk.
Elevated levels suggest infection or chronic inflammation.
Higher values increase heart disease risk.

aliases: urine routine, urine analysis, urine complete analysis
interpretation_summary: Detects infection, kidney issues, or metabolic abnormalities.
